subject: When to run which tests
msgSnippet: ... I disagree. I would rather run all the tests less frequently than the wrong tests frequently. If some of the tests are expensive to execute, then move them
messageBody:
Timothy Wall wrote:

> And while it's true as JB notes that you might not be able to have a
> theoretically 100% accurate dependency tracking, a 95% accurate reading
> would probably be better than running tests too infrequently because
> they take too long, or spending a lot of time manually munging about
> reconfiguring test suites.

I disagree. I would rather run all the tests less frequently than the
wrong tests frequently. If some of the tests are expensive to execute,
then move them to CruiseControl and let them run every 10 minutes. It's
not great, but it's better than nothing. At least you'll know within 10
minutes of checking code in whether it broke a slow test. Moving a slow
test into the "slow test" suite isn't much maintenance.
